Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice or heavy chalice white slip; interior glazed streaky black, with part of rosette with alternating added red and added white petals with centre of red dot on white; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of sphinx seated to left (part of hindquarters with red patch remaining); rising roundel as filling ornament; below, narrow band.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the sphinx, see Lemos 1991, pl. 57, no. 419 from Emporio and for the rosette, pl. 84, no. 658 from Athens. Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Group of Light-Walled Naukratis Animal Chalices. All sherds in this group are small and offer very little by way of information beyond the fact that they come from light-walled chalices; the decoration on sherds belonging to this group is also poorly or carelessly drawn (Lemos 1991, 93). However, given the thickness of this particular sherd, it is probable that it came from a heavy chalice
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 93, p. 258, no. 482)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1341) (phase 2)
